neighbors.name: Todd A. Gladfelter & Karen Gladfelter
neighbors.claims: Todd A. Gladfelter and Karen Gladfelter are residents of Hedgesville, West Virginia ([Kelso-Cornelius Funeral Home](https://www.kelso-corneliusfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Richard-M-Dick-Johnson-Jr?obId=1771219)). They are listed as owners of a residential property on Michelle Dr in Berkeley County ([Veripages](https://veripages.com/name/Todd/Gladfelter/)). Public records identify them as a married couple living in the Hedgesville area ([Kelso-Cornelius Funeral Home](https://www.kelso-corneliusfuneralhome.com/obituaries/Richard-M-Dick-Johnson-Jr?obId=1771219)). No record of either holding local official positions or speaking at county meetings regarding development was found in available archives.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private residents; no public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via informal, personal outreach to understand any concerns; emphasize respectful communication and community benefits in discussions.

neighbors.verification_notes: Confirmed identity via obituary listing 'stepson, Todd Gladfelter and wife Karen of Hedgesville, WV'. Distinguished from a chainsaw carving artist named Todd Gladfelter in PA who is married to Cindy Ross. No stance on development found.

neighbors.name: Jamie G. Roseman & Dianna L. Roseman
neighbors.claims: Jamie G. Roseman and Dianna L. Roseman jointly own property in the Falling Waters area of Berkeley County ([Berkeley County Assessor](https://www.berkeleywv.org)). No separate business or organizational affiliations were identified in local public records ([Martinsburg Journal](https://www.journal-news.net)). Neither individual appears in local news or civic documents regarding land use or development debates.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through a friendly introduction at their residence; listen to any questions and share clear, factual information about the project.

neighbors.name: Scott Michael Shimel
